Study: No Evidence for Temperature-Dependence of the COVID-19 Epidemic
Effect: no evidence that spread rates decline with temperatures above 20 oC
Sample (n): Data from WHO, ECDC, and John Hopkin CSSA on all affected countries

Study: Effects of temperature on COVID-19 transmission
Effect: Changes in temperature shows no significant correlation with cases transmitted, deaths or recovered:

Study: Association between ambient temperature and COVID-19 infection in 122 cities from China
Effect: Our results indicate that mean temperature has a positive linear relationship with the number of COVID-19 cases with a threshold of 3 Â°C.

Study: Effects of temperature variation and humidity on the mortality of COVID-19 in Wuhan
Factors Described: Temperature, Diurnal Temperature Range, Relative Humidity, Air Pollutant
Effect: Each 1 unit increase in diurnal temperature range was only associated with a 2.92% (95% CI: 0.61%, 5.28%) increase in COVID-19 mortality at lag 3

Study: The Effects of "Fangcang, Huoshenshan, and Leishenshan" Makeshift Hospitals and Temperature on the Mortality of COVID-19
Effect: if the AT rises 1 Celsius, the mortality of confirmed cases would decrease 0.44% and the mortality of severe cases would decrease 0.42% on average.
